200.description: List of rewards and balances aggregated for all addresses registered to the organization and rolled up to the requested `time_rollup`.

items.description: rewards earned by the validator for the given period

text.description: The textual version of the rewards in ETH

currency.description: Currency of rewards textual representation. Always `ETH`

numeric.description: Numerical representation of the rewards in wei

exp.description: The exponent to use for converting numeric value to ETH. Always `18`.

recipient.description: Recipient of the execution rewards (tip). Only available in execution rewards for epoch/daily rollup.

sender.description: Address of MEV builder that sent the execution rewards (tips) to the validator

slot.description: Slot number of the proposal made by the validator

block.description: Execution layer block number of the proposal made by the validator

is_mev.description: Whether or not MEV boost was used for the proposal

mev_relay.description: Name of the mev boost service (if proposal was mev boosted)

tx_hash.description: Hash of the transaction used to send MEV boosted tips

items.description: Total balance of the validator at the end of each given period.

text.description: The textual version of the balance in ETH

currency.description: Currency of balance textual representation. Always `ETH`

numeric.description: Numerical representation of the balance in wei

exp.description: The exponent to use for converting numeric value to ETH. Always `18`.

epoch.description: The Epoch number (only present when epoch time_rollup is requested).

timestamp.description: The timestamp of the end of the period rewards are reported for.

withdrawal_credentials.description: The withdrawal credentials of the validator entity.

withdrawal_address.description: Eth1 Withdrawal address of the validator. Only available when withdrawal credentials is not a BLS.

started_at.description: Timestamp of the earliest record of rewards we have indexed for the validator. Only available in all_time time_rollup requests.

protocol.description: The name of the protocol queried.

network.description: The name of the network queried.

time_rollup.description: The time rollup unit of the rewards.

pagination.description: Pagination information. Only available for all_time time_rollup and when the request supplies 'page' parameter.

time_rollup.description: ETH rewards are distributed every epoch but you can get them aggregated by day or all time.

start.description: Will return rewards from that date. Accepts a timestamp ("YYYY-MM-DD") or an epoch (as a string).

end.description: Will return rewards to that date. Accepts a timestamp ("YYYY-MM-DD") or an epoch (as a string).

pubkeys.description: A list of validator pubkeys for filtering.

withdrawal_addresses.description: A list of withdrawal addresses or credentials for filtering.

size.description: Max number of entries to return. Only available when time_rollup is "all_time".

number.description: page number of result set. Only available when time_rollup is "all_time"

index.description: The unique index of the withdrawal on chain (from round robin process).

pubkey.description: The public key of the validator.

withdrawal_address.description: The withdrawal address of the validator.

amount_numeric.description: The withdrawal amount (as an integer) - needs exp below.

exp.description: The exponent used to calculate the final ETH amount.

full_withdrawal.description: Whether the validator exited or not.

slot.description: The consensus layer slot at which the withdrawal occurred.

block_number.description: The execution layer block at which the withdrawal occurred.

epoch.description: The epoch in which the withdrawal sweep happened.

timestamp.description: The timestamp of the end of the epoch.

protocol.description: The name of the protocol queried.

network.description: Name of the network on which rewards were earned.

start.description: Lower bound of withdrawal data expressed as epoch number (for epoch rollup only) or timestamps (as strings "YYYY-MM-DD"). This parameter is ignored when all_time rollup is requested.

end.description: Upper bound of withdrawal data expressed as epoch number (for epoch rollup only) or timestamps (as strings "YYYY-MM-DD"). This parameter is ignored when all_time rollup is requested.

withdrawal_addresses.description: A set of withdrawal addresses (or withdrawal credentials) to include in the results.

pubkeys.description: A set of validator public keys to include in the results.

parameters.name: figment
parameters.description: If `true`, returns reward rates for Figment validators. If not, returns reward rates for the ETH network.

parameters.name: avg
parameters.description: If `7d`, returns the 7 days moving average. If not, returns the daily spot rates.

parameters.name: decimal
parameters.description: Specifies the number of desired decimal to be returned. Accepts values between 2 (default) and 5.

200.description: List of rewards rates by date.

date.description: Timestamp for the day in format "YYYY-MM-DD"

value.description: The total annualized reward rate for that day - in %.

consensus.description: The piece due to consensus layer rewards (inflation) - in %.

execution.description: The piece due to execution layer rewards (transaction fees) - in %.

parameters.name: history
parameters.description: If `true`, returns historical daily estimates. Defaults to `false`.

hours.description: If funded now, when a validator would start receiving rewards.
If exited now, when a validator would stop receiving rewards.

hours_min.description: If exited now, when the principal would be available (best case scenario).

hours_max.description: If exited now, when the principal would be available (worst case scenario).

protocol.description: The name of the protocol queried.

network.description: The name of the network queried.
The network on which validators will be created.

validators_count.description: The number of validators that need to be created.

withdrawal_address.description: An ETH wallet address used for the withdrawals credentials of the validators. This is the address that will receive consensus rewards and unstaked ETH after exiting.

funding_address.description: An ETH wallet address that holds the ETH to be staked and that will sign the staking transaction. If not specified, `withdrawal_address` will be used.

fee_recipient_address.description: An ETH wallet address that will receive the execution layer rewards. If not specified, `withdrawal_address` will be used.

region.description: The geographic region where the validator will be created.

parameters.name: withdrawal_address
parameters.description: The validator's withdrawal address. Must be prefixed with `0x`.

parameters.name: region
parameters.description: The validator's geographic region. Only for Figment validators.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: The current validator's status. See https://docs.figment.io/docs/lifecycle-eth-validator.

parameters.name: net_fee_payout_address
parameters.description: The ETH wallet address that receives the net execution layer rewards (when they go through a fee splitting smart contract).

schema.description: A comma-separated list of additional objects to include in the response.

size.description: Number of items to include in the response.

pubkey.description: The pubkey for the validator. Must be prefixed with `0x`.

signed_transaction.description: The unsigned transaction, serialized with the signature. See https://docs.figment.io/v2.0/docs/signing-transactions.

unsigned_transaction_serialized.description: The unsigned transaction received from the create validators endpoint. See https://docs.figment.io/v2.0/reference/create-validators.

signature.description: The signature corresponding to the unsigned transaction. See https://docs.figment.io/v2.0/docs/signing-transactions. Must be prefixed with `0x`.

items.description: The pubkeys of the validators that need to be exited. Must be prefixed with `0x`.

withdrawal_address.description: The withdrawal address of the validators that should be exited. Must be prefixed with `0x`.

validators_count.description: The number of validators to exit.

200.description: A rewards result set with metadata.

stake_account.description: Returns the stake account that received the rewards.

validator.description: Returns the validator that distributed the rewards.

system_account.description: Returns the system account that stake account was created from.

epoch.description: The epoch number. Only available on epoch time_rollup

timestamp.description: The timestamp at the end of the epoch.

items.description: The formula to compute the final rewards in the currency unit is numeric x 10^(-exp).

text.description: The textual version of the other fields in the rewards object.

type.description: The type of reward. Either "mev" or "protocol"

text.description: The textual version of the other fields in the rewards object.

protocol.description: The name of the protocol queried.

network.description: The name of the network queried.

parameters.name: figment
parameters.description: If true is passed, we will return the reward rate for Figment validators only. If omitted or any other value is passed, we will return the reward rate of the network as a whole.

parameters.name: avg
parameters.description: Returns the 7 day moving average. The only value accepted is 7d, if no value is passed, the original behavior of returning a single day average ARR is used.

parameters.name: decimal
parameters.description: Adds decimal places to the returned values. Accepts values 2, 3, 4, 5. If nothing is passed, it will default to 2.

date.description: Specific date associated with value (staking reward rates).

200.description: Transaction payload to create a Vault.

network.description: Network name
Network name

region.description: Region to provision the Validators in your Vault

200.description: Transaction payload to set validator manager and fee recipient address.

network.description: Network name

200.description: Transaction payload to update a Vault allow list.

network.description: Network name

wallet_address.description: A list of eth wallet addresses to add or remove from the allow list

allowed.description: Sets the address to allowed or not allowed

422.description: Transaction failed due to invalid input parameters

network.description: Network name

schema.description: Start date for rewards data. Defaults to 1 month ago.

200.description: Transaction payload to enter in the exit queue.

network.description: Network name

200.description: Transaction payload to claim the withdrawal.

network.description: Network name

timestamp.description: The timestamp when the shares entered the exit queue

network.description: Network name
Which Aptos network to stake on.

parameters.name: pubkey
parameters.description: The pubkey for the validator. Must be prefixed with `0x`.

epoch.description: The earliest epoch at which the validator can exit. This field must be retrieved from the decrypted exit message.

validator_index.description: The index of the validators to be exited. This field must be retrieved from the decrypted exit message.

signature.description: The exit message signature. This field must be retrieved from the decrypted exit message.

parameters.name: start
parameters.description: List activity starting at or after this time.

parameters.name: end
parameters.description: List activity up to this time.

size.description: Number of items to include in the response.

parameters.name: funding_address
parameters.description: Funding address for validators related to activity

parameters.name: withdrawal_address
parameters.description: Withdrawal address for validators related to activity

parameters.name: pubkey
parameters.description: The pubkey for the validator. Must be prefixed with `0x`.

schema.description: A comma-separated list of additional objects to include in the response.

parameters.name: operated_by
parameters.description: if `figment`, returns data for Figment-operated validators only

size.description: Number of items to include in the response.

200.description: A rewards result set with metadata.

delegator_address.description: The account that received the reward. This is a checksummed ethereum address including lower case and capital letters.

validator.description: The "owner address" of the validator which distributed the rewards.

timestamp.description: The timestamp of the end of the checkpoint.

items.description: The formula to compute the final rewards in the currency unit is numeric x 10^(-exp).

text.description: The textual version of the other fields in the rewards object.
The textual version of the other fields in the balances object.

exp.description: The exponent used to calculate the final MATIC amount.

protocol.description: The name of the protocol queried.

network.description: The name of the network queried.

start.description: Either checkpoint (number) or timestamps (strings formatted like "YYYY-MM-DD").

end.description: Either checkpoint (number) or timestamps (strings formatted like "YYYY-MM-DD").

network.description: Network name

transaction_hash.description: The transaction hash from the onchain broadcast.

network.description: Network name

epoch.description: Epoch as stated in the PSET

validator_index.description: The validator's index as stated in the PSET

signature.description: Signature as stated in the PSET

id.description: A unique UUID for the validator.

pubkey.description: The pubkey for the validator. Prefixed with `0x`.

status.description: The current status of the validator.

withdrawal_credentials.description: Withdrawal credentials for the validator funds to be withdrawn upon exit.

fee_recipient_address.description: The fee recipient address that receives Execution Layer fees. For Figment-operated validators only.

net_fee_payout_address.description: The net payout address that receives the customer's share of Execution Layer fees. For Figment-operated validators only.

region.description: The geographic region in which the validator operates. For Figment-operated validators only.

amount.description: An amount of ETH in GWEI required to deposit

signature.description: A "proof of possession" which signs over pubkey, withdrawal_credentials, and amount using the validator private key.

figment_signature.description: A base64 encoded signature of the validator's public key, signed by a private key maintained by Figment.

deposit_cli_version.description: The version of the CLI software used when making the deposit.

estimated_active_at.description: Estimate of when the validator will become active and start earning rewards.

estimated_exit_at.description: Estimate of when the validator will exit and stop earning rewards.

estimated_withdrawal_at.description: Estimate of when the principal will be withdrawable.

requested_at.description: A timestamp representing the customer request to exit this validator, either through the Figment app or Staking API.

approved_at.description: A timestamp representing the time at which the customer exit request was approved by Figment.

submitted_at.description: A timestamp representing the time at which the validator's exit transaction was submitted to Ethereum's consensus layer.

request_id.description: The unique request ID (which may be the Staking API flow ID) used to request an exit for this validator.

fork_version.description: A pre-signed exit message fork version.
